analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa la de med /

original: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong bas /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong bas /

original: grol pa'i rigs pa bshad de /
analyzed: grol pa'i rigs pa bshad de /

original: sred pa zhig pa slar skye ba'i rgyu yin /

original: dmigs pa la sogs @267a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs @267a * //

analyzed: de bas stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yin par bshad de /

analyzed: stong pa nyid med na dmigs pa la chags pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i sems skye ste /

original: smras pa / don du ni yul la rmongs pas chags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / don du ni yul la rmongs pas chags pa'i phyir /

original: des ci bsgrubs ci 'ang de med do //

analyzed: kun rdzob khas blangs pas chad pa'i mtha'o //

original: de bas dbu ma'i lam gyis 'khor ba la gnas pa grub ste /
analyzed: de bas dbu ma'i lam gyis 'khor ba la gnas pa grub ste /

original: shes rab kyis srid pa'i skyon gyis ma gos /
analyzed: shes rab kyis srid pa'i skyon gyis ma gos /

analyzed: 'o na don dam par sdug bsngal ba med pas gnas nas ci bya zhe na / smras @267b pa ;

analyzed: de bas snying rjes gnas kyang shes rab kyis srid pa'i skyon gyis mgos pas /

original: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /

analyzed: de bas the tshom mi za bar rang bzhin med pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: lan ni / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya kho na sgrib pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid mun pa ste don dam pa la bsgribs pas so //

analyzed: de spong ba'i rgyu stong pa nyid yin pas myur du thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pas /

analyzed: stong pa nyid ci ste mi bsgom 'bad de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Why not meditate on emptiness? One should meditate on it with effort.

original: stong pa nyid la 'jigs pa gang bshad pa //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la 'jigs pa gang bshad pa //
translated: The fear of emptiness that has been explained

original: de la lan bshad de /
analyzed: de la lan bshad de /

analyzed: dngos gang la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po gang sdug bsngal bskyed pa de la 'jigs par rigs /
translated: It is right to fear that thing which produces suffering.

analyzed: stong pa nyid ni srid pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pas 'jigs pa'i gnas ma yin pa la ci ste 'jigs /

analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu la dga' ba kho nar rigs so //

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

translated: But when there is no other than what is analyzed as ‚Äúself‚Äù and is not a word or concept,

analyzed: pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'jigs pa su la 'ong de'i tshe dpyad pas 'jigs pa ldog go //

analyzed: de gsungs pa / bdag ni da ltar 'ong 'gyur med //

analyzed: zhes so // de nyid dpyad par tshigs bcad gsum gyis bshad de /

original: so la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: bdag ma yin na ni bdag gi rkyen yul ma yin no //

original: sna bas ni sna las byung ba'o //

original: bad kan ni lud pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan ni lud pa'o //

original: rnag ni khrag smin pa'o //
analyzed: rnag ni khrag smin pa'o //

analyzed: bdag ni zhag dang zhes bya ba la @268a * //

original: sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rgyus pa ni rus tshigs sbrel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyus pa ni rus tshigs sbrel ba'o //

original: drod ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: drod ni lus kyi'o //

analyzed: rlung ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wind is the exhalation and inhalation, etc.

original: bug dgu ni rna bug gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang sna bug dang / kha dang bshad pa dang / gci ba'i bu ga'o //
analyzed: bug dgu ni rna bug gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang sna bug dang / kha dang bshad pa dang / gci ba'i bu ga'o //
translated: The nine orifices are the two ears, the two eyes, the two nostrils, the mouth, the anus, and the urethra.

analyzed: rnam shes drug ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam shes te drug go //
translated: The six consciousnesses are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses.

original: rnam kun ni so sor ram tshogs pa bdag ma yin /
analyzed: rnam kun ni so sor ram tshogs pa bdag ma yin /
translated: In no way is the body the self, either individually or collectively.

analyzed: 'di ltar so la sogs pa tshogs pa'i bdag nyid lus dmigs pa la so sor bdag 'dzin gyi rtog pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the body, which is the collection of the parts such as the feet, is not the object of the conception of self that apprehends the self as individual from the body,

original: bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the self.

original: tshogs pa yang de dag 'ba' zhig pa ste ;
analyzed: tshogs pa yang de dag 'ba' zhig pa ste ;
translated: The collection is only those parts.

original: de dag la de gcig pu mi srid de /
analyzed: de dag la de gcig pu mi srid de /
translated: It is not possible that the self is only those parts,

analyzed: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // du ma la gcig tu 'dzin pa yang ma 'khrul pa ma yin /

original: 'khrul pa la yang de nyid med //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang de nyid med //
translated: Even in error, that is not so.

original: de bas rtog pa tsam 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas rtog pa tsam 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is merely a conceptual thought.

original: shes rig gi skyes bu'i spyod yul bdag / rigs pa bas 'dod pa de 'ang mi rigs te /
analyzed: shes rig gi skyes bu'i spyod yul bdag / rigs pa bas 'dod pa de 'ang mi rigs te /
translated: The assertion of the logicians that the self is the domain of the cognition of the person is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir bdag ser po bde ba dang ldan mig gcig pa la sogs pa'i bdag lus la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag ser po bde ba dang ldan mig gcig pa la sogs pa'i bdag lus la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is the one with a yellow body, one eye, and so on, and it exists in the body.

analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin bdag tu smra ba grangs can la sogs pa rnam shes drug gi rang bzhin bdag tu smra ste /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on, who propound that the nature of the mind is the self, propound that the nature of the six consciousnesses is the self.

original: de la lan bshad de /
analyzed: de la lan bshad de /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: gal te sgra'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra'i la sogs pa'o //

original: gal te sgra'i rnam shes kyi bdag nyid can /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i rnam shes kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: if it is the nature of the consciousness of sound,

original: bdag yin na de rtag pa yin pas sgra'i rnam shes kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yin na de rtag pa yin pas sgra'i rnam shes kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it is permanent, the consciousness of sound would also be permanent.

analyzed: de'i tshe sgra yang de yod pa dang med pa'i dus su rtag tu gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar yin mod shes pa rtog tu nye bar gnas te /

analyzed: sgra ni res 'ga' ba yin pas rtag tu yod par mi gsal zhe na /
translated: Sound is sometimes present and sometimes not, so it is not clear that it exists permanently.

original: smras pa ; shes bya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; shes bya la sogs pa'o //

original: de med pa'i dus su shes par bya ba sgra med pas ci shes /
analyzed: de med pa'i dus su shes par bya ba sgra med pas ci shes /

analyzed: gang gi shes byas stong yang shes pa zhes brjod do //

original: de gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: de gnyis bshad de /

original: gal te yul mi shes kyang shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul mi shes kyang shes pa yin na /

original: de'i tshe shing yang shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe shing yang shes par 'gyur /
translated: then at that time a tree would also be knowledge.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang ma yin zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang ma yin zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that it is not like that for others.

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis yul med pa shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis yul med pa shes pa ma yin /
translated: By what reason is the non-existent object not knowledge?

original: des shes par bya ba ring du gyur pas shes pa yang med par nges so //
analyzed: des shes par bya ba ring du gyur pas shes pa yang med par nges so //
translated: Since what is to be known by it is far away, it is certain that there is no knowledge.

original: gal te sgra'i shes pa kho na bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i shes pa kho na bdag yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas gzugs 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid kyis zhes @268b bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: sgra'i rnam shes de ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam shes de ma yin zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: gzhan yang sgra 'dzin pa'i rnam shes gang yin pa de nyid gzugs 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: cha shas med pa gcig la rang bzhin gnyis mi srid pas so //

analyzed: de ni rtog pas gzhag pa yin gyi gcig gnyis ka'i bdag nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te gzugs dang sgra 'dzin pa'i rnam shes gcig yin na /

analyzed: shing dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na mi shes pa de 'jig par thal //

original: brgyal ba la sogs pas sems pa med pa na yang mi shes pa ste /

original: de ni ma yin @271a * //
analyzed: de ni ma yin @271a * //
translated: that is not so.

original: te yan lag rnams la yan lag can gyi cha gnas pas /
analyzed: te yan lag rnams la yan lag can gyi cha gnas pas /
translated: Since a part of the possessor of parts abides in the parts,

original: yan lag can rang dgar gnas de mi shes so //
analyzed: yan lag can rang dgar gnas de mi shes so //
translated: the possessor of parts is not known to exist independently.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la gal te bdag nyid kun gyi lag pa la sogs pa la lus yan lag can gyis khyab na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la gal te bdag nyid kun gyi lag pa la sogs pa la lus yan lag can gyis khyab na /
translated: In the second case, if the body, the possessor of parts, pervades the hand, etc., in its entirety,üîΩthen the body would be perceived in each part.

original: de'i tshe lag pa la sogs pa ji snyed pa lus kyang de tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lag pa la sogs pa ji snyed pa lus kyang de tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the body would be as many as the hands and so on.

original: de bas nang na ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas nang na ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not internal.

original: shes rig gi skyes bu sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rig gi skyes bu sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conscious person has been refuted earlier.

original: sha la sogs pa bcad pas lus nang du ma yin no //
analyzed: sha la sogs pa bcad pas lus nang du ma yin no //
translated: The body is not internal, since it is not cut off by cutting off the flesh and so on.

original: de ltar yan lag can bkag pas /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag can bkag pas /
translated: Thus, since the possessor of parts has been refuted,

original: phyi rol du mngon sum la sogs pa'i spyod yul kyang lus ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du mngon sum la sogs pa'i spyod yul kyang lus ma yin no //
translated: the body is not the domain of perception and so on in the external world.üîΩHow is the body posited in the hands and so on?

original: lag pa la sogs par lus ji ltar rnam par gzhag / gal te lag pa la sogs pa las gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs par lus ji ltar rnam par gzhag / gal te lag pa la sogs pa las gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: If it is different from the hands and so on,

original: smras pa / lag pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa lus med de /
analyzed: smras pa / lag pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa lus med de /
translated: we reply: The body is not different from the hands and so on,

original: snang rung ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang rung ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived, although it should be visible.

original: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: Thus, the body does not exist as the intrinsic nature of the hands and so on,

original: de la brten pa'am de dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: de la brten pa'am de dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: as something dependent on them, as something related to them,

original: de'i nang na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i nang na gnas pa'am /
translated: as something located within them,

original: de las tha dad pa med pas /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa med pas /
translated: or as something different from them.

original: ji ltar yod de mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar yod de mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid do //
translated: How can it exist? It does not exist, because it is not perceived.

original: de bas de'i phyir dpyad pas lus med de /
analyzed: de bas de'i phyir dpyad pas lus med de /
translated: Therefore, the body does not exist through analysis.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du lag pa la sogs pa la lus kyi blo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du lag pa la sogs pa la lus kyi blo 'byung ngo //
translated: The idea of a body arises in regard to the hand, etc., through the power of ignorance, in conventional usage.

original: gzhan du ci ste med ce na /
analyzed: gzhan du ci ste med ce na /
translated: Why is it not otherwise?

original: smras pa / lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par gyis 'khrul pas lag pa la sogs pa kho na las te /
analyzed: smras pa / lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par gyis 'khrul pas lag pa la sogs pa kho na las te /
translated: It is said: The idea of a body arises in regard to the hand, etc., through the error of arranging the shape of the hand, foot, etc.

original: mtho yor la mir 'dzin pa'i blo bzhin te /
analyzed: mtho yor la mir 'dzin pa'i blo bzhin te /
translated: It is like the idea of a man in regard to a scarecrow,

original: langs pa'i dbyibs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs pa'i dbyibs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the shape of a standing man.

original: ci ste gti mug gis lus kyi blo 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gti mug gis lus kyi blo 'byung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy does the idea of a body arise through delusion?‚Äù

original: smras pa / ji srid la sogs pa'o //üîΩsngar mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'ang med la /
analyzed: smras pa / ji srid la sogs pa'o // sngar mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'ang med la /
translated: It is said: As long as the conditions of the collection of the six elements, earth, etc., are assembled,üîΩthe idea of a body arises in regard to that collection.üîΩIt does not exist in the earlier stage of the embryo,

original: phyis thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'ang med /
analyzed: phyis thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'ang med /
translated: nor does it exist in the later stage of ashes, etc.

original: 'on kyang sa la sogs pa khams drug tshogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa ji srid du /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa la sogs pa khams drug tshogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa ji srid du /
translated: However, as long as the conditions of the collection of the six elements, earth, etc., are assembled,

original: de srid lus la mi la sogs pa'i blo 'byung dgongs pa 'di ste /
analyzed: de srid lus la mi la sogs pa'i blo 'byung dgongs pa 'di ste /
translated: for that long the idea of a man, etc., arises in regard to the body. This is the intention.

original: tshogs pa de dang de yod pas //
analyzed: tshogs pa de dang de yod pas //
translated: Because of the existence of this and that collection,

original: rang bzhin med kyang 'khrul pas skyes bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin med kyang 'khrul pas skyes bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: even though they are essenceless, the conceptions of a person and so forth arise through error.

original: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa la de tshogs pa yod pa'i bar du lus kyi snang ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa la de tshogs pa yod pa'i bar du lus kyi snang ba 'byung ngo //
translated: In this way, as long as the collection of hands and so forth exists, the appearance of the body arises.

original: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa yang brtags pa kho nar bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa yang brtags pa kho nar bshad de /
translated: In this way, it is explained that even the hands and so forth are only imputed.

original: @271b de bzhin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @271b de bzhin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The same goes for the feet and so forth.

original: lus bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'ang med de /
analyzed: lus bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'ang med de /
translated: Just as the body does not exist, the hands, feet, and so forth do not exist.

original: sor mo'i phung po yin pas de las gzhan rkang pa'ang med do //
analyzed: sor mo'i phung po yin pas de las gzhan rkang pa'ang med do //
translated: Since they are a collection of fingers, the foot does not exist apart from them.

original: sor mo'i phung po'ang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: sor mo'i phung po'ang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The collection of fingers is also not a thing,

original: tshigs kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a collection of joints.

original: tshigs kyang dngos po ma yin te //
analyzed: tshigs kyang dngos po ma yin te //
translated: The joints are also not things,

original: rang gi cha shas phye bas so //
analyzed: rang gi cha shas phye bas so //
translated: because they are divided into their own parts.

original: tshigs kyi cha shas kyang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs kyi cha shas kyang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The parts of the joints are also not things,

original: rdul phra rab tu phye bas so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu phye bas so //
translated: because they are divided into subtle particles.

original: rdul phra rab kyang re re nas dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyang re re nas dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The subtle particles are also not things individually,üîΩbecause they have parts.

original: shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs dang 'brel pas tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs dang 'brel pas tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be different in relation to the east, west, south, north, below, and above.

original: de bshad pa /
analyzed: de bshad pa /
translated: This is explained:

original: drug gi cig car sbyar ba na //
analyzed: drug gi cig car sbyar ba na //
translated: If the six are simultaneously applied,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle would have six parts.

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
translated: If the six are in one place,

original: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //üîΩzhes so // rdul phra rab kyi cha shas de yang sngar bzhin du drug tu phye bas dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur // zhes so // rdul phra rab kyi cha shas de yang sngar bzhin du drug tu phye bas dngos po ma yin te /
translated: the aggregate would be just the size of an atom.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That part of the subtle particle, like before, is divided into six parts, and is not a thing, because it is partless.

original: rgyu mtshan des nam mkha' stong pa nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan des nam mkha' stong pa nyid kho na ste /
translated: For that reason, space is just emptiness.

original: rdul phra rab med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab med do //
translated: There are no subtle particles.

original: de ltar dngos po brdzun pa la sgro btags nas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po brdzun pa la sgro btags nas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar bshad de /
translated: Thus, having exaggerated a false thing, attachment and so forth arise.

original: de ltar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar la sogs pa'o //
translated: In that way, and so forth.

original: bshad pa'i rim pas rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs la yid du 'ong bar brtags nas su chags /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rim pas rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs la yid du 'ong bar brtags nas su chags /
translated: In the sequence of explanation, having imagined a dream-like form to be attractive, one is attached.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba la su sdang / gzugs tsam la sra bar brtags nas su rmongs /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba la su sdang / gzugs tsam la sra bar brtags nas su rmongs /
translated: Who would hate what is unpleasant? Who would be deluded by merely imagining solidity in mere form?

original: de ltar sgra la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sgra la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Sound, etc. are to be explained in the same way.

original: dpyod ldan ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod ldan ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: The wise are the discerning.

original: 'du shas med na bud med la sogs pa'i rtog pa yang mi rigs par bshad de /
analyzed: 'du shas med na bud med la sogs pa'i rtog pa yang mi rigs par bshad de /
translated: If there is no discrimination, then the idea of a woman, etc. is not reasonable.üîΩThis is explained in the following:

original: gang tshe la sogs pa'o //üîΩgang gi tshe bshad pa'i rigs pas lus med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang tshe la sogs pa'o // gang gi tshe bshad pa'i rigs pas lus med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When there is no body, etc.

original: chags pa dang chags pa 'dod chags kyi yul gang yin pa de med do //
analyzed: chags pa dang chags pa 'dod chags kyi yul gang yin pa de med do //
translated: When there is no body, as has been explained by the reasoning stated, then there is no object of passion, nor one who is passionate, nor passion.

original: de ltar lus rjes su dran pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus rjes su dran pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the mindfulness of body,

original: tshor ba bshad de /
analyzed: tshor ba bshad de /
translated: he explains the mindfulness of feeling.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the topic of the verse beginning with ‚ÄúSuffering,‚Äù etc.

original: tshor ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Feeling is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / bde sdug ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / bde sdug ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: de la don dam par sdug bsngal yod na de'i tshe rab tu dga' ba rnams la ci ste mi gnod /
analyzed: de la don dam par sdug bsngal yod na de'i tshe rab tu dga' ba rnams la ci ste mi gnod /
translated: If suffering exists ultimately, then why does it not afflict those who are delighted?

original: bde ba yang don dam par yod na de'i tshe mya ngan la sogs pa gdung ba rnams la sogs pa'i sgras 'jigs pa la sogs pas gdung ba rnams la zhim sogs ni lce'i yul btung ba la @272a * //üîΩsogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang don dam par yod na de'i tshe mya ngan la sogs pa gdung ba rnams la sogs pa'i sgras 'jigs pa la sogs pas gdung ba rnams la zhim sogs ni lce'i yul btung ba la @272a * // sogs pa ste /
translated: If pleasure exists ultimately, then at that time, for those who are tormented by grief and so on, and for those who are tormented by fear and so on, the objects of the tongue such as delicious food and so on,üîΩand the objects of touch such as garlands, sandalwood paste and so on,

original: sogs pa'i sgras phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyu yin na ci ste dga' bar mi byed /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyu yin na ci ste dga' bar mi byed /
translated: which are causes of pleasure, why do they not bring about pleasure?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nam yang mi ldog pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nam yang mi ldog pas so //
translated: The nature of things never changes.

original: de bas bde ba dang sdug pa'i yul brtags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas bde ba dang sdug pa'i yul brtags pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the objects of pleasure and pain are only imagined.

original: sdug bsngal yod pa yang bde ba stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mi myong zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod pa yang bde ba stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mi myong zhe na /
translated: If you say that you do not experience pain because powerful pleasure overwhelms it,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: mi gsal bas myong ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin na tshor ba'i rang bzhin ji ltar yin /
analyzed: mi gsal bas myong ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin na tshor ba'i rang bzhin ji ltar yin /
translated: If it is not clear and not by nature experienced, how can it be feeling?

original: myong bas tshor bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong bas tshor bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because feeling is explained as experience.

original: rig kyang tshor ba yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig kyang tshor ba yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If awareness is feeling, there is a logical fallacy.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad du med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad du med pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that there is no suffering at all.

original: 'on kyang phra mo yod /
analyzed: 'on kyang phra mo yod /
translated: However, there is subtle suffering.

original: de'i tshe dga' ba'i gnas skabs su 'jug pa'i bde ba stobs can gyis sdug bsngal gyi rags pa bsal ba yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe dga' ba'i gnas skabs su 'jug pa'i bde ba stobs can gyis sdug bsngal gyi rags pa bsal ba yin nam /
translated: At that time, is the powerful pleasure that enters the state of joy able to remove the gross suffering?

original: sdug bsngal phra mo yang de'i tshe mi myong bas dris te phra mo gang yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phra mo yang de'i tshe mi myong bas dris te phra mo gang yin /
translated: Or, since one does not experience subtle suffering at that time, what is that subtle suffering?

original: kun slong bde ba las gzhan dga' ba tsam 'dod na lan bshad de /
analyzed: kun slong bde ba las gzhan dga' ba tsam 'dod na lan bshad de /
translated: If you assert that the motivation is merely joy, not pleasure, then that is the response.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyi phra mo ma yin /
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyi phra mo ma yin /
translated: Moreover, it is not subtle suffering.

original: dga' ba tsam ni bde ba'i rigs yin pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba tsam ni bde ba'i rigs yin pas so //
translated: Merely joy is a type of pleasure.

original: des sdug bsngal phra ba ni bde ba la med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des sdug bsngal phra ba ni bde ba la med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, subtle suffering does not exist in pleasure.

original: rgyu med pas 'ga' zhig tu ma dmigs she na /üîΩsmras pa / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pas 'ga' zhig tu ma dmigs she na / smras pa / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not observed in some instances?‚ÄùüîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúIf pleasure is the absence of suffering,‚Äù and so on.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba bde ba'i rgyu reg bya mngon phyogs pa'i tshe sdug bsngal mi skye zhes brjod na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba bde ba'i rgyu reg bya mngon phyogs pa'i tshe sdug bsngal mi skye zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that when the cause of pleasure, a tangible object that is the opposite of suffering, is present, suffering does not arise, then that is the response.

original: de'i tshe tshor bar rtogs pas mngon par zhen pa nyid yin zhe na bya bar grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshor bar rtogs pas mngon par zhen pa nyid yin zhe na bya bar grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that it is not established that the object of the action is the feeling, then you have not understood the feeling.

original: gzhan du na gang la gcig gi bde ba de nyid du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gzhan du na gang la gcig gi bde ba de nyid du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Otherwise, what is pleasure for one is pain for another.

original: sngar gang thos kyang sdug bsngal skye //
analyzed: sngar gang thos kyang sdug bsngal skye //
translated: When one hears the sound of a drum, pain arises.

original: de dus gzhan du mthong nas dga' ba skye /
analyzed: de dus gzhan du mthong nas dga' ba skye /
translated: When one sees it at another time, pleasure arises.

original: de bas tshor ba dang de'i rgyu brtags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas tshor ba dang de'i rgyu brtags pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only the feeling and its cause that are investigated.

original: bshad pa yang /
analyzed: bshad pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: sbrul gyis rma bya bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sbrul gyis rma bya bde bar 'gyur //
translated: The bite of a snake becomes pleasure for a peacock.

original: dug ni bcud len de goms la //üîΩrnga mo'i kha la gnod pa yi //
analyzed: dug ni bcud len de goms la // rnga mo'i kha la gnod pa yi //
translated: Poison is an elixir for one who is accustomed to it.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tsher ma ni //üîΩkhyad par rnga mo'i kha la bde //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tsher ma ni // khyad par rnga mo'i kha la bde //
translated: The thorns that cause harm to the mouth of a camelüîΩAre special thorns for the mouth of a camel.

original: tsher ma khyad par bde ba'i rgyu //
analyzed: tsher ma khyad par bde ba'i rgyu //
translated: The special thorns are the cause of pleasure.

original: zhes so // rgyu bshad de /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu bshad de /
translated: The cause is explained.

original: de nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself and so on.

original: gang gi phyir tshor ba mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshor ba mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: Because feeling has the nature of attachment.

original: de phyir de la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po rnam dpyad tshor ba rjes su dran pa bsgom pa yin /
analyzed: de phyir de la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po rnam dpyad tshor ba rjes su dran pa bsgom pa yin /
translated: Therefore, the antidote to the attachment to that is the cultivation of the mindfulness of feeling that investigates.

original: 'di bas tshor ba mngon par zhen pa bshad de /
analyzed: 'di bas tshor ba mngon par zhen pa bshad de /
translated: Here, the attachment to feeling is explained.

original: rnam brtags la sogs @272b pa'o //
analyzed: rnam brtags la sogs @272b pa'o //
translated: The feeling that arises from the cause of investigation, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa'i zhing las byung ba'i bsam gtan 'dod pa dang / mi dge ba dang bral ba rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa'i zhing las byung ba'i bsam gtan 'dod pa dang / mi dge ba dang bral ba rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the concentration that arises from the field of investigation is free from desire and nonvirtue, it is associated with investigation and analysis, and it is the joy and bliss that arises from seclusion.

original: rtog pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba rnal 'byor pa'i zas yin rtog pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: rtog pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba rnal 'byor pa'i zas yin rtog pa nyid du grub po //
translated: The joy and bliss that arises from investigation is the food of the yogi. It is established as investigation.

original: de ltar tshor ba'i rgyu khas blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba'i rgyu khas blangs te /
translated: Thus, having accepted the cause of feeling,

original: mngon par zhen pa tsam du tshor ba bshad nas /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa tsam du tshor ba bshad nas /
translated: having explained feeling as mere attachment,

original: da ni rgyu med pas tshor ba dngos po ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: da ni rgyu med pas tshor ba dngos po ma yin par bshad de /
translated: now, since it has no cause, feeling is explained as not being a thing.

original: gal te la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te la sogs pa'o //
translated: If, etc.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ste yul dang dbang po rnam shes gsum tshogs pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ste yul dang dbang po rnam shes gsum tshogs pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling. The coming together of the three‚Äîobject, faculty, and consciousness‚Äîis contact.

original: de yang ma grub pas tshor ba ga la yod de /
analyzed: de yang ma grub pas tshor ba ga la yod de /
translated: But if that does not exist, how can feeling exist?

original: 'di ltar dbang po dang don dam par bcas la reg pa 'byung ngam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po dang don dam par bcas la reg pa 'byung ngam /
translated: Does contact occur when the faculty and the object are separated?

original: 'on te bar med la /üîΩde la de gnyis par dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe 'di gnyis tshogs pa ga la yod /
analyzed: 'on te bar med la / de la de gnyis par dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe 'di gnyis tshogs pa ga la yod /
translated: Or does it occur when they are not separated?üîΩIf they are separated, then how can they come together?

original: tshogs pa las byung ba'i reg pa bar bcas ga la yod /
analyzed: tshogs pa las byung ba'i reg pa bar bcas ga la yod /
translated: How can there be contact that arises from a coming together of the two, when they are separated?

original: gal te bar med gnyis yin na /
analyzed: gal te bar med gnyis yin na /
translated: If they are not separated,

original: de'i tshe yang thams cad du phan tshun du zhugs pas su dang su phrad /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang thams cad du phan tshun du zhugs pas su dang su phrad /
translated: then since they would be mutually interpenetrated everywhere, what would come into contact with what?

original: gcig pur gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na rdul phra rab ni phrad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig pur gyur pa'i phyir ro // 'o na rdul phra rab ni phrad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Because they would be single.üîΩBut if atoms come into contact,

original: smras pa / rdul phran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rdul phran la sogs pa'o //
translated: then they would have parts, because they would be mutually interpenetrating.üîΩBut if they do not come into contact,

original: rdul phran gcig gcig gi nang du mi 'jug / bu ga med pa dang mnyam pas mthon dman med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phran gcig gcig gi nang du mi 'jug / bu ga med pa dang mnyam pas mthon dman med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then they would be separated, because they would not interpenetrate.

original: 'o na 'jug pa med kyang phrad pa tsam yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jug pa med kyang phrad pa tsam yod ce na /
translated: But if there is no engagement, is there mere contact?

original: smras pa / thams cad du 'jug pa med pas ma 'dres shing ma 'dres pas phrad pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad du 'jug pa med pas ma 'dres shing ma 'dres pas phrad pa med do //
translated: It is said: Since there is no engagement anywhere, there is no contact because there is no mixing, and because there is no mixing.

original: shin tu chung ba la yang cha yod pas cha med pa la gzugs med pas /
analyzed: shin tu chung ba la yang cha yod pas cha med pa la gzugs med pas /
translated: Since even the very small has parts, the partless does not exist.

original: med pa nyid la phrad pa ga la yod /
analyzed: med pa nyid la phrad pa ga la yod /
translated: How can there be contact with what does not exist?

original: 'di ni khyed la yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed la yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin par bshad de /
translated: This is explained as not established by valid cognition for you.

original: phrad pa yod na cha med pa mi 'grub /
analyzed: phrad pa yod na cha med pa mi 'grub /
translated: If there were contact, the partless would not be established.

original: gal te mthong nas bstan par gyis /
analyzed: gal te mthong nas bstan par gyis /
translated: If you see, then explain!

original: gsum pa bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa bshad de /
translated: The third is explained.

original: rnam shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness and so on.

original: rnam shes gzugs can ma yin pas de la phrad pa shin tu'ang med do //
analyzed: rnam shes gzugs can ma yin pas de la phrad pa shin tu'ang med do //
translated: Since consciousness is not physical, it does not have contact at all.

original: de ltar gsum la phrad pa bkag nas de tshogs pa yang dngos po ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar gsum la phrad pa bkag nas de tshogs pa yang dngos po ma yin par bshad de /
translated: Thus, having refuted contact in the three, it is explained that their collection is not a thing.

original: tshogs pa yang dngos po ma yin pas ri bong gi rva bzhin tshogs pa med do //
analyzed: tshogs pa yang dngos po ma yin pas ri bong gi rva bzhin tshogs pa med do //
translated: Since the collection is not a thing, like the horn of a rabbit, the collection does not exist.

original: de bzhin sor mo'i tshogs yin phyir la sogs pas sngar ji ltar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo'i tshogs yin phyir la sogs pas sngar ji ltar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: and so on, as was explained earlier.

original: nye bar bsdus @273a * //
analyzed: nye bar bsdus @273a * //
translated: The summary

original: shing bshad de /
analyzed: shing bshad de /
translated: is stated:

original: de bas bshad pa'i rim pas reg pa med pa na tshor ba ga la srid de /
analyzed: de bas bshad pa'i rim pas reg pa med pa na tshor ba ga la srid de /
translated: Therefore, since there is no contact, how can there be feeling?

original: rgyu med pa na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without a cause, there is no effect.

original: de bas bde ba dang sdug pa'i rgyu thob pa dang spang ba'i phyir reg pa ni nam mkha' bza' ba ltar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas bde ba dang sdug pa'i rgyu thob pa dang spang ba'i phyir reg pa ni nam mkha' bza' ba ltar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to seek contact in order to obtain the cause of pleasure and pain and to avoid the cause of suffering, just as it is not reasonable to eat space.

original: sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is in order to end suffering,

original: smras pa / bdag med pa dang / tshor ba rang bzhin med pas gnod byed brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gnod par 'gyur /üîΩda ni de'i rgyan can sred pa yang mi rigs par bshad de /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag med pa dang / tshor ba rang bzhin med pas gnod byed brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gnod par 'gyur / da ni de'i rgyan can sred pa yang mi rigs par bshad de /
translated: we reply: Since there is no self and feeling has no intrinsic nature, the refutation is to be applied to what is imagined. By whom and in what way is there any refutation?

original: gang tshe la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, it is explained that craving, which is associated with that, is also unreasonable:üîΩWhen there is no contact, there is no feeling.

original: gang gis tshor ba po bdag med la tshor ba yang med pa de'i tshe rang gi rgyu med pa'i gnas skabs mthong na pha'i mya ngan gyis skye sred pa ci ste khyod ldog par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis tshor ba po bdag med la tshor ba yang med pa de'i tshe rang gi rgyu med pa'i gnas skabs mthong na pha'i mya ngan gyis skye sred pa ci ste khyod ldog par mi 'gyur /
translated: When you see that the experiencer does not exist and that feeling also does not exist, then, when you see that it has no cause, why would you not stop your longing for existence due to the grief of your father?

original: khyod mi 'byung ba kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: khyod mi 'byung ba kho nar rigs so //
translated: It is only right that you not arise.

original: gal te tshor ba po dang tshor ba med na 'o na dngos po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad cis she na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba po dang tshor ba med na 'o na dngos po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad cis she na /
translated: If the experiencer and feeling do not exist, then why do we use expressions such as ‚Äúseeing‚Äù in regard to things?

original: smras pa / mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: We reply: Seeing and so on.

original: mig gi rnam shes kyis mthong ba dang / lus kyi dbang po'i rnam shes kyis reg pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes kyis mthong ba dang / lus kyi dbang po'i rnam shes kyis reg pa ste /
translated: Seeing is by the eye consciousness, and feeling is by the body sense faculty consciousness.

original: 'o na sems nyid tshor ba po don dam par yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sems nyid tshor ba po don dam par yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIs the mind itself ultimately existent?‚Äù

original: smras pa / don dam par yod pa des ma yin gyi 'on kyang rmi lam dang sgyu ma lta bu bag chags las byung ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / don dam par yod pa des ma yin gyi 'on kyang rmi lam dang sgyu ma lta bu bag chags las byung ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: We reply: No, it is not ultimately existent, but rather it is the mind that arises from habitual tendencies, like a dream or an illusion.

original: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba sems las gzhan sems kyis ci ste mi mthong /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba sems las gzhan sems kyis ci ste mi mthong /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy does the mind not see feelings such as pleasure that are different from the mind?‚Äù

original: lan ni sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi bag chags las sems dang lhan cig tu tshor ba skye ste /
analyzed: lan ni sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi bag chags las sems dang lhan cig tu tshor ba skye ste /
translated: The answer is: because it arises simultaneously with the mind, feeling arises simultaneously with the mind from previous latent impressions.

original: lhan cig tu skye ba kho nas mthong ba yin don dam par tshor ba mthong ba med do //
analyzed: lhan cig tu skye ba kho nas mthong ba yin don dam par tshor ba mthong ba med do //
translated: It is seen only because it arises simultaneously; ultimately, feeling is not seen.

original: lhan cig tu skyes pas mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul gyi rnam pa can de las byung ba'i shes pas de 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig tu skyes pas mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul gyi rnam pa can de las byung ba'i shes pas de 'dzin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not seen because it arises simultaneously, but rather that consciousness that arises from it apprehends it as having the aspect of the object,

original: 'dir lan ni tshigs bcad gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni tshigs bcad gnyis kyis te /
translated: the answer to that is given in two verses.

original: sngar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first verse begins with ‚ÄúPreviously . . . ‚Äù

original: dngos po snga ma phyis 'byung ba'i shes pas dran pa yin gyi myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po snga ma phyis 'byung ba'i shes pas dran pa yin gyi myong ba ma yin te /
translated: The previous entity is remembered by a subsequent consciousness, but it is not experienced,

original: shes pa'i dus su de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i dus su de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the consciousness it has ceased.

original: 'gags pa de rang gi tshul gyis kyang tshor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa de rang gi tshul gyis kyang tshor ba ma yin no //
translated: That which has ceased does not feel by its own nature.

original: rang rig sngar bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig sngar bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because self-awareness has been refuted earlier,

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyang rang gis mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyang rang gis mi rig pa'o //
translated: it is not that it is aware of itself.

original: 'o na gzhan gyis rig gam ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyis rig gam ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is known by something else, no.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang myong ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang myong ba yin /
translated: Others also experience it.

original: de yang rang rig ma yin pas de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang rig ma yin pas de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not self-awareness, it is similar to that.

original: gang gis @273b tshor ba tshor te tshor ba po yang med do //
analyzed: gang gis @273b tshor ba tshor te tshor ba po yang med do //
translated: By what is feeling felt? There is no feeler.

original: de bas mtshan nyid kyis stong pas don dam par tshor ba med do //
analyzed: de bas mtshan nyid kyis stong pas don dam par tshor ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is empty of intrinsic identity, ultimately there is no feeling.

original: mngon par zhen pa las gzhan de bas su la yang bde ba dang sdug pa dang rang gi med de /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las gzhan de bas su la yang bde ba dang sdug pa dang rang gi med de /
translated: Apart from mere adherence, there is no one who feels pleasure or pain.

original: rjes su 'gro ba cig med pas de ltar bdag med pa'i tshogs 'di la tshor ba 'di yis su la gnod /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba cig med pas de ltar bdag med pa'i tshogs 'di la tshor ba 'di yis su la gnod /
translated: Since there is no single, pervasive self, who is harmed by this feeling in this body, which is devoid of self?

original: gang la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang ma yin no //
translated: No one at all.

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las /
translated: The S≈´tra of the Realized Dharma-Gathering says:

original: tshor ba myong bas bshad pa ste //
analyzed: tshor ba myong bas bshad pa ste //
translated: Feeling is explained as experience.

original: 'di ni su yis myong bar byed //
analyzed: 'di ni su yis myong bar byed //
translated: By whom is it experienced?

original: tshor bya tshor byed tshor ba ni //
analyzed: tshor bya tshor byed tshor ba ni //
translated: The object of feeling and the feeler

original: tha dad 'gyur ba med pas so //
analyzed: tha dad 'gyur ba med pas so //
translated: are not different, nor are they undifferentiated.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis tshor ba la //üîΩde ltar dran pa nyer gzhag bya //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis tshor ba la // de ltar dran pa nyer gzhag bya //
translated: The wise should be mindful of feeling

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in this way, through the close placement of mindfulness.

original: tshor ba rjes su dran pa bshad nas sems rjes su dran pa bshad de /
analyzed: tshor ba rjes su dran pa bshad nas sems rjes su dran pa bshad de /
translated: Having explained the recollection of feelings, he explains the recollection of mind.

original: yid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind, etc.

original: re zhig mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la'ang yid gnas pa ma yin gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la'ang ma yin /
analyzed: re zhig mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la'ang yid gnas pa ma yin gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la'ang ma yin /
translated: The mind does not dwell in the sense faculties such as the eyes, nor in the objects such as form.

original: gzugs yul dang dbang po'i bar du'ang ma yin ;
analyzed: gzugs yul dang dbang po'i bar du'ang ma yin ;
translated: It is not between form and the sense faculty,

original: lus kyi nang ngam phyi'i yan lag rnams la'ang ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyi nang ngam phyi'i yan lag rnams la'ang ma yin /
translated: nor inside or outside the body, nor in the limbs.

original: bshad pa rnams las gzhan phyogs su 'ang dpyad pas ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa rnams las gzhan phyogs su 'ang dpyad pas ma mthong ngo //
translated: It is not seen by investigating in other directions.

original: sems gang lus kyi phyi nang du med pas lus las dngos po gzhan du yang med /
analyzed: sems gang lus kyi phyi nang du med pas lus las dngos po gzhan du yang med /
translated: Since the mind is not in the body, inside or outside, it is not a different entity from the body.

original: phyi nang 'dres pa la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi nang 'dres pa la'ang mi gnas /
translated: It does not dwell in the mixture of inside and outside.

original: tha dad du yang med de don dam par med do //
analyzed: tha dad du yang med de don dam par med do //
translated: It is not separate. Ultimately, it does not exist.

original: de bas sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bas sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are naturally in nirvana.

original: yid dpyad nas mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa dpyad cing bshad de /
analyzed: yid dpyad nas mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa dpyad cing bshad de /
translated: Having analyzed the mind, he analyzes and explains the eye consciousness, etc.

original: shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of cognition, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa brten nas gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa skye zhes gzhan rig rtogs nas smras pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa brten nas gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa skye zhes gzhan rig rtogs nas smras pa /
translated: The assertion that the eye consciousness and so on arise in dependence on the collection of the eye faculty and so on and apprehend form and so on is a realization of the other, that is, of the Sautrantikas.

original: shes bya las sngar ram /
analyzed: shes bya las sngar ram /
translated: Is the object of consciousness prior to it,

original: dus mnyam pa'am yang na phyis te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'am yang na phyis te /
translated: simultaneous with it, or subsequent to it?

original: de la gzung bya las sngar shes bya ma skyes par gal te shes pa ma yin na /üîΩde'i tshe gang dmigs nas de skye /
analyzed: de la gzung bya las sngar shes bya ma skyes par gal te shes pa ma yin na / de'i tshe gang dmigs nas de skye /
translated: If the object of consciousness has not arisen prior to consciousness, then at that time, what is it that arises having observed it?

original: gal te shes bya dang dus mnyam pa'i shes pa yin na de'i tshe ci dmigs nas de 'byung /
analyzed: gal te shes bya dang dus mnyam pa'i shes pa yin na de'i tshe ci dmigs nas de 'byung /
translated: If it is the consciousness that is simultaneous with the object of consciousness, then at that time, what is it that arises having observed it?

original: dus mnyam pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is simultaneous is not a cause.

original: rgyu ma yin pa spyod yul ma yin no //üîΩgal te shes pa dang po de 'gags nas phyis shes pa de skye na /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa spyod yul ma yin no // gal te shes pa dang po de 'gags nas phyis shes pa de skye na /
translated: That which is not a cause is not an object.

original: de'i tshe shes pa gal skye /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa gal skye /
translated: If the consciousness that arises later is the one that arises after the first consciousness has ceased, then at that time, what is it that arises having observed it?

original: dmigs bya 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs bya 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the observed object has ceased.

original: de bas don dam bar tshogs pa las kyang mi 'grub bo //üîΩde ltar sems @274a * //
analyzed: de bas don dam bar tshogs pa las kyang mi 'grub bo //üîΩde ltar sems @274a * //
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, it is not established that consciousness arises from a collection.üîΩThus, in the ultimate sense, consciousness does not arise from a collection.

original: rjes su dran pa bshad nas chos rjes su dran pa gsungs pa'i rim pas bshad de /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa bshad nas chos rjes su dran pa gsungs pa'i rim pas bshad de /
translated: The order of the explanation is that, after explaining the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Dharma is explained.

original: de ltar chos la sogs pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du chos thams cad dang dngos po rnams rang gi rgyu'i sngon nam /
analyzed: de ltar chos la sogs pa'o // de bzhin du chos thams cad dang dngos po rnams rang gi rgyu'i sngon nam /
translated: Thus, the Dharma and so on.

original: lhan cig gam phyis skye ba'ang skyon 'di nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig gam phyis skye ba'ang skyon 'di nyid do //
translated: Similarly, all phenomena and things arising before, together with, or after their causes have this very fault.

original: skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: skye ba med pas 'gag pa yang mi rigs so //
translated: Since there is no arising, cessation is also not tenable.

original: de ltar chos rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pas chos thams cad la ma chags pa'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pas chos thams cad la ma chags pa'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, through the close placement of mindfulness of the Dharma, the knowledge of non-attachment to all phenomena arises.

original: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi rigs pas bden pa gnyis med ces pha rol pos smras te /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi rigs pas bden pa gnyis med ces pha rol pos smras te /
translated: Thus, since conventional truth is not tenable, the opponent says, There is no two truths.

original: gal te la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te la sogs pa'o //
translated: If and so on.

original: gal te don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes ma 'gags na kun rdzob med pas tha snyad mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gal te don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes ma 'gags na kun rdzob med pas tha snyad mi 'grub po //
translated: If ultimately all phenomena are unborn and unceasing, then since the conventional does not exist, conventions are not established.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho na grub pas bden pa gnyis med de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho na grub pas bden pa gnyis med de /
translated: Since only the ultimate truth alone is established, there is no two truths.

original: bsod nams sogs pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams sogs pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Merit and so on would not exist.

original: gal te rgyud gzhan gyi blos rnam par gzhag pa'i kun rdzob yod na /
analyzed: gal te rgyud gzhan gyi blos rnam par gzhag pa'i kun rdzob yod na /
translated: If the conventional existed by the power of the mind of another continuum,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig pa ma yin gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan gyi rtog pa'i blos rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig pa ma yin gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan gyi rtog pa'i blos rnam par gzhag na /
translated: then ultimate truth would not be exclusively so, and the conventional would also be posited by the mind of another‚Äôs thought.

original: sems can mya ngan las ga la 'da'/
analyzed: sems can mya ngan las ga la 'da'/
translated: How could sentient beings attain nirvana?

original: stong pa yang rtog pas yul du byed pas kun rdzob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa yang rtog pas yul du byed pas kun rdzob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even emptiness would become conventional because it is made an object by thought.

original: don dam pa rtogs nas spros pa thams cad mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs nas spros pa thams cad mi dmigs pas /
translated: After realizing the ultimate, all elaborations are not observed.

original: sems can gang mya ngan las 'das /üîΩde yang blos dmigs pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro /
analyzed: sems can gang mya ngan las 'das / de yang blos dmigs pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro /
translated: What sentient being would attain nirvana?üîΩMoreover, since the mind observes it, nirvana would go to the conventional.

original: blo kun rdzob brjod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'ang kun rdzob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo kun rdzob brjod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'ang kun rdzob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i shes pa'i mthus gzhal bya'i don rnam par bzhag na /

translated: is a cause that depends on another.üîΩThe world understands thatüîΩthe cause of the arising of thingsüîΩis a cause that depends on another.üîΩThe world understands that
