original: grangs de nyid shes pa'i yang 'jig rten bzhin du 'di ni tha snyad yod /
analyzed: grangs de nyid shes pa'i yang 'jig rten bzhin du 'di ni tha snyad yod /
translated: Just as the world knows thatness, it also knows conventional reality.

original: de'ang zan za ba mthong gos 'dod kyang ras bal gyi sa bon mi nyo'o /
analyzed: de'ang zan za ba mthong gos 'dod kyang ras bal gyi sa bon mi nyo'o /
translated: Moreover, although one sees that one eats food and desires cloth, one does not buy cotton seeds.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa gang gis rtogs //üîΩshes @279a * //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa gang gis rtogs // shes @279a * //
translated: By what means is it known that the effect exists in the cause?

original: pa de tha snyad pa'i skye bo la yang yod pas /
analyzed: pa de tha snyad pa'i skye bo la yang yod pas /
translated: That knowledge exists even for ordinary beings.

original: de nyid shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten pas ci ste mi mthong /
analyzed: de nyid shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten pas ci ste mi mthong /
translated: Why do ordinary beings not see things as they are, just as the knower of reality does?

original: 'jig rten gyis mthong ba tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis mthong ba tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the perception of ordinary beings is not valid cognition,

original: lan 'debs pa pos gal te 'jig rten tshang ma ma yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa pos gal te 'jig rten tshang ma ma yin na de'i tshe /
translated: the MƒÅdhyamika replies: If ordinary beings are not valid,

original: des gsal bar mthong ba yang bden pa ma yin 'di ni dbu ma pas 'dod pa nyid do /
analyzed: des gsal bar mthong ba yang bden pa ma yin 'di ni dbu ma pas 'dod pa nyid do /
translated: then what they clearly perceive cannot be true. This is precisely what the MƒÅdhyamika asserts.

original: pha rol pos 'di smras te /
analyzed: pha rol pos 'di smras te /
translated: The opponent objects:

original: gal te tshad ma don dam par tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma don dam par tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If valid cognition is not valid ultimately,

original: des gzhal ba brdzun par mi 'gyur ram des ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: des gzhal ba brdzun par mi 'gyur ram des ci ste zhe na /
translated: then is it not the case that what it cognizes is false?

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid tshad ma nges pa gang yin pa de'ang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid tshad ma nges pa gang yin pa de'ang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The MƒÅdhyamika replies: If you say that, then the valid cognition that ascertains emptiness‚Äîthe ultimate absence of intrinsic existence‚Äîwould also not exist ultimately.

original: lan bshad de ;
analyzed: lan bshad de ;
translated: The MƒÅdhyamika responds:

original: rtog pas brtags pa'i dngos po ma brtags pas de dngos med 'dzin pa ma yin /
analyzed: rtog pas brtags pa'i dngos po ma brtags pas de dngos med 'dzin pa ma yin /
translated: The object that is imputed by thought is not apprehended as nonexistent by a mind that has not analyzed.üîΩWhen one analyzes a place and ascertains that there is no pot there,

original: sa phyogs la brtags pa'i bum pa med par rtogs so //
analyzed: sa phyogs la brtags pa'i bum pa med par rtogs so //
translated: one understands that there is no pot.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpyad pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpyad pas /
translated: Through analysis that is renowned in the world,

original: der bum pa'i gzugs gang yang med do /
analyzed: der bum pa'i gzugs gang yang med do /
translated: one understands that there is no form of a pot at all.

original: de bas brtags pa'i dngos po ma grub pas med pa'o ;üîΩde phyir brdzun pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de med pa gsal bar brdzun /
analyzed: de bas brtags pa'i dngos po ma grub pas med pa'o ; de phyir brdzun pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de med pa gsal bar brdzun /
translated: Therefore, since the examined thing is not established, it does not exist.üîΩTherefore, whatever is a false thing is clearly non-existent.

original: de ltar dngos dang dngos min brtags pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos dang dngos min brtags pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, since the existence and non-existence of things are examined,

original: rang bzhin med pa kho na gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa kho na gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: only the absence of intrinsic nature remains.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed de de bas rmi lam du gnas pa'i bu skyes nas 'chi na de med rmi ba'i rtog pas bu de yod par rtog pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed de de bas rmi lam du gnas pa'i bu skyes nas 'chi na de med rmi ba'i rtog pas bu de yod par rtog pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: This is clarified, and therefore, if a son is born and dies in a dream, the conception of the existence of that son by the dreaming consciousness is refuted by the non-existence of that son.

original: yod pa'i rtog pa 'gog par byed kyang de brdzun yin bu de rmi lam du ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i rtog pa 'gog par byed kyang de brdzun yin bu de rmi lam du ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although the conception of existence is refuted, that is false because the son is not born in the dream and does not cease.

original: yang na bu bden la rmi lam du shi ba la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bu bden la rmi lam du shi ba la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, this should be applied to a son who is true and dies in a dream.

original: de ltar chos rnams skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
translated: Thus, phenomena are born and cease.

original: 'di tshad ma ma yin kyang rang bzhin med pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: 'di tshad ma ma yin kyang rang bzhin med pa la skyon med do //
translated: Although this is not a valid cognition, there is no fault in the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mnyam pa bsal nas nye bar bsdus te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mnyam pa bsal nas nye bar bsdus te /
translated: Having thus refuted causelessness and unequal causes, he concludes:

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin las 'bras bu mi 'byung /üîΩde bas de ma thag pa'i dpyad pas 'ga' 'ang rgyu med yod ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin las 'bras bu mi 'byung / de bas de ma thag pa'i dpyad pas 'ga' 'ang rgyu med yod ma yin /
translated: Since effects do not arise from their own nature,üîΩand since no one is produced without a cause,üîΩand since they are not produced by a person, time, and so on,

original: skyes bu dang dus la sogs pas byas pa yang med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dang dus la sogs pas byas pa yang med par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that they are not produced from any of these.

original: des rgyu med pa la ma yin par grub po //
analyzed: des rgyu med pa la ma yin par grub po //
translated: This proves that they are not produced without a cause.

original: 'o na rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa las mi skye na yang /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa las mi skye na yang /
translated: If they are not produced from their own nature, ƒ™≈õvara, the primal substance, and so on,

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu las don dam par skye bas ji ltar rang bzhin med ce na /üîΩ'dir rang las ma yin gzhan las min /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu las don dam par skye bas ji ltar rang bzhin med ce na / 'dir rang las ma yin gzhan las min /
translated: then how can they be essenceless, since they are ultimately produced from desired causes?

original: gnyis las ma yin zhes mtha' gsum bsgrub par bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin zhes mtha' gsum bsgrub par bshad de /
translated: Here, it is explained that the three extremes are established by ‚Äúnot from itself, not from another, not from both, not without cause.‚Äù

original: @279b so so la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: @279b so so la sogs pa'o /
translated: The three extremes are the extremes of self, other, and so on.

original: de la rang ngam gzhan so so re re la ma yin /
analyzed: de la rang ngam gzhan so so re re la ma yin /
translated: They are not produced from each of self and other individually,

original: gnyis 'dus pa la yang ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis 'dus pa la yang ma yin /
translated: nor are they produced from the combination of both,

original: rkyen rnams las skye ba'i tshul du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen rnams las skye ba'i tshul du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: nor do they exist as produced from conditions.

original: de la re zhig rang las dngos po mi skye ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang las dngos po mi skye ste /
translated: First, an entity does not arise from itself.

original: skye ba'i sngon du dngos po med pa'i phyir gang las skye /
analyzed: skye ba'i sngon du dngos po med pa'i phyir gang las skye /
translated: Because prior to arising, the entity does not exist, from what would it arise?

original: skyes na'ang rdzogs pa'i phyir ci skye /
analyzed: skyes na'ang rdzogs pa'i phyir ci skye /
translated: If it arose, since it would be complete, what would arise?

original: gzhan yang kho na las skye na skyes pa nyid slar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho na las skye na skyes pa nyid slar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it arose from itself, that which has arisen would arise again.

original: de ni mi rigs byas pa byed pa mi srid pas so //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs byas pa byed pa mi srid pas so //
translated: That is illogical, because it is impossible for that which has been done to be done again.

original: yang nas bon la sa bon kho na 'byung gi myu gu nam yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: yang nas bon la sa bon kho na 'byung gi myu gu nam yang mi skye'o //
translated: Moreover, a seed arises from a seed, but a sprout never arises from a seed.

original: sa bon dang myu gu ngo bo gcig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu ngo bo gcig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: A seed and a sprout are not the same entity.

original: rang gi dngos po bskyed na gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po bskyed na gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it generated its own entity, nothing would arise,

original: phan tshun du brten pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang bzhin yod na skye /
analyzed: phan tshun du brten pa'i phyir ro // rang bzhin yod na skye /
translated: because they would be mutually dependent.üîΩIf it existed through its essence, it would arise.

original: skyes nas rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes nas rang bzhin no //
translated: Having arisen, it would have an essence.

original: gzhan las ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from another,

original: s'a lu'i sa bon las sran ma'i myu gu skye bar thal lo //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon las sran ma'i myu gu skye bar thal lo //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that a mung bean sprout would arise from a rice seed.

original: gzhan nyid du khyad med pas thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du khyad med pas thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there would be no difference in being different, everything would arise from everything.

original: bskyed bya dang skyed byed kyi nus pa nges pa can yin pas skyon med ce na /
analyzed: bskyed bya dang skyed byed kyi nus pa nges pa can yin pas skyon med ce na /
translated: But if you say that there is no error because there is a definite potency of the producer and the produced,

original: ma yin te /üîΩ'bras bu ma skyes pa'i tshe su'i nus pa /
analyzed: ma yin te / 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i tshe su'i nus pa /
translated: that is not so.üîΩWhen the effect has not yet arisen, whose potency is it?

original: 'bras bu skyes nas rgyu med pas su la nus pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes nas rgyu med pas su la nus pa /
translated: When the effect has arisen, there is no cause. Whose potency is it?

original: dus mi mnyam pas bskyed bya dang / skyed byed kyi nges pa yang med do //üîΩrgyun gcig gis nges pa'ang mi rigs te rgyun med pa kho nas so //
analyzed: dus mi mnyam pas bskyed bya dang / skyed byed kyi nges pa yang med do // rgyun gcig gis nges pa'ang mi rigs te rgyun med pa kho nas so //
translated: Since they are not simultaneous, there is no definite producer and produced.

original: gnyi ga la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that they are ascertained by a single continuum because there is no continuum.

original: so so la bkod pa'i skyon rnams 'dir 'byung bar thal bas so //
analyzed: so so la bkod pa'i skyon rnams 'dir 'byung bar thal bas so //
translated: It is not both because the errors that are individually posited arise here.

original: so sor mi nus na bsdus kyang mi nus pas so //
analyzed: so sor mi nus na bsdus kyang mi nus pas so //
translated: If they are not individually able, they are not able even when combined.

original: long ba brgya tham pas yang mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: long ba brgya tham pas yang mi mthong bas so //
translated: A hundred blind people do not see.

original: bye ma gcig gis snum 'byin mi nus pa ltar mang po bsdus kyang mi nus pa bzhin no //üîΩdngos po rnams 'jig rten 'das pa las da ltar ba /
analyzed: bye ma gcig gis snum 'byin mi nus pa ltar mang po bsdus kyang mi nus pa bzhin no // dngos po rnams 'jig rten 'das pa las da ltar ba /
translated: Just as one grain of sand is not able to produce oil, many combined are also not able.üîΩThings go from the past to the present,

original: da ltar ba las /
analyzed: da ltar ba las /
translated: from the present to the future.

original: ma 'ongs par 'gro zhes dus gsum smra ba rtogs nas bshad de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par 'gro zhes dus gsum smra ba rtogs nas bshad de /
translated: Having understood the three times, it is explained.

original: dus dang phyogs gzhan las cung zad kyang byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: dus dang phyogs gzhan las cung zad kyang byung ba ma yin la /
translated: It does not come from any other time or direction.üîΩIt does not abide in the present, and it does not go from the present to the future.

original: da ltar ba la mi gnas de las ma 'ongs par yang mi 'gro / gang gi phyir de lta yin na 'dus bas kyang rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar ba la mi gnas de las ma 'ongs par yang mi 'gro / gang gi phyir de lta yin na 'dus bas kyang rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would be permanent, because it would always exist.

original: rtag tu yod pa'i phyir da ltar ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'i phyir da ltar ba kho na'o //
translated: It would be only the present.

original: rang bzhin rtag tu yod pa dang dngos po rtag par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin rtag tu yod pa dang dngos po rtag par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not accept that an essence always exists and that a thing is permanent.

original: dngos po rang bzhin las gzhan min //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin las gzhan min //
translated: A thing is not different from its essence.

original: dbang phyug spyod 'dis gsal ba yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug spyod 'dis gsal ba yin //
translated: This is the activity of the Almighty.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i bsdus pa yin no //üîΩde ltar dus gsum @280a * //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i bsdus pa yin no // de ltar dus gsum @280a * //
translated: This is the summary of the Sarvastivada.

original: las 'das pas sgyu ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: las 'das pas sgyu ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
translated: Thus, since it transcends the three times, what is the difference between it and an illusion?

original: rmongs pas bden par gang byas pa 'di sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa las /
analyzed: rmongs pas bden par gang byas pa 'di sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa las /
translated: What is made true by delusion is no different from an elephant conjured up by a magician.

original: rgyu las byung ba 'di la rang bzhin med pas khyad med de /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba 'di la rang bzhin med pas khyad med de /
translated: Since this, which arises from causes, is essenceless, it is no different from that.

original: de nyid bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid bshad de /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: rnam shes la sogs pa sgyu mas sprul pa dang / 'jig rten du grags pa'i rgyus byas pa 'di gang las 'byung /
analyzed: rnam shes la sogs pa sgyu mas sprul pa dang / 'jig rten du grags pa'i rgyus byas pa 'di gang las 'byung /
translated: How could consciousness and so on arise from that which is conjured by an illusion or that which is produced by causes renowned in the world?üîΩWhen they cease, where do they go?

original: 'gags pa'i dus su gar 'gro ba rigs pa phra mos brtag par bya /
analyzed: 'gags pa'i dus su gar 'gro ba rigs pa phra mos brtag par bya /
translated: This should be analyzed with subtle reasoning.

original: 'o na rgyus bskyed pa ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyus bskyed pa ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
translated: Well, why is it that what is produced by causes is not real?

original: smras pa / gang zhig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang zhig la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said:

original: dngos po gang rgyu nye na mthong gi de med na mi mthong /
analyzed: dngos po gang rgyu nye na mthong gi de med na mi mthong /
translated: Whatever is seen when its cause is near and not seen when its cause is not present

original: gzhan la rag las pas me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pas me long gi gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs la /
translated: is like a reflection in a mirror, which depends on something other.

original: me long yod na byad mthong gi de med na mi mthong /
analyzed: me long yod na byad mthong gi de med na mi mthong /
translated: When there is a mirror, a face is seen; when there is not, it is not seen.

original: de ltar dngos po yang rgyu dang nye ba dang ring ba la'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yang rgyu dang nye ba dang ring ba la'o //
translated: In the same way, things are seen when their causes are near and not seen when they are not.

original: gzhan la rag las pas byas pa rang bzhin ma yin pa la bden pa ga la yod /üîΩgzhan yang rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i bdag nyid rgyus dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pas byas pa rang bzhin ma yin pa la bden pa ga la yod / gzhan yang rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i bdag nyid rgyus dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: Since they are produced in dependence on something other, how could they be real?

original: med pa'am gnyi ga'i rang bzhin bskyed /
analyzed: med pa'am gnyi ga'i rang bzhin bskyed /
translated: Moreover, a cause produces an existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent thing.

original: de la rgyu'i bya ba'i sngon du yod pa la rgyus dgos pa ci /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i bya ba'i sngon du yod pa la rgyus dgos pa ci /
translated: What need is there for a cause of that which exists prior to the activity of the cause?

original: rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already complete.

original: gnyis pa bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa bshad de /
translated: The second is explained:

original: 'on te de ni med pa na yang rgyus ci bya /
analyzed: 'on te de ni med pa na yang rgyus ci bya /
translated: But if it does not exist, what does the cause do?

original: ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa la rgyu'i bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa la rgyu'i bya ba med pas so //
translated: The activity of a cause does not exist in regard to that which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'o na med pa nyid rgyu las skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na med pa nyid rgyu las skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt nonexistence itself produced from a cause?

original: smras pa / dngos med nam mkha' lta bu la bye ba brgya phrag rgyu yis kyang bsgyur du med de gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos med nam mkha' lta bu la bye ba brgya phrag rgyu yis kyang bsgyur du med de gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: A nonentity, like space, cannot be altered by a cause, even by a hundred million causes, because it is formless.

original: dngos po yin du chug ce na /
analyzed: dngos po yin du chug ce na /
translated: But let it be an entity.

original: smras pa / dngos po ma yin pa de ji ltar dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ma yin pa de ji ltar dngos por 'gyur /
translated: We reply: How can that which is not an entity become an entity?

original: dngos po ma yin pa las log nas she na /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa las log nas she na /
translated: If it is by turning away from nonentity.

original: smras pa / dngos po ma yin pa las log nas gzhan dngos por gyur ba gang zhig yin /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ma yin pa las log nas gzhan dngos por gyur ba gang zhig yin /
translated: We reply: What is it that turns away from nonentity and becomes an entity?

original: zan za ba la sogs pas rgyu yongs su smin pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zan za ba la sogs pas rgyu yongs su smin pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it stops the ripening of the cause of eating food, and so on.

original: sngar med pa log nas dngos po 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: sngar med pa log nas dngos po 'byung zhe na /
translated: If it is by turning away from what did not exist previously and an entity arises.

original: smras pa / dngos med kyi dus su dngos po mi 'byung na gang gi tshe nam dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos med kyi dus su dngos po mi 'byung na gang gi tshe nam dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Objection: If a thing does not arise at the time of non-thing, when will a thing arise?

original: dngos min 'gal tshabs can gyis rtag tu don dam pas dngos po skye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos min 'gal tshabs can gyis rtag tu don dam pas dngos po skye bar mi nus so //
translated: A non-thing that is contradictory with a thing is always incapable of giving rise to a thing ultimately.

original: skye 'gyur gyi dngos pos dngos min bzlog ce na /
analyzed: skye 'gyur gyi dngos pos dngos min bzlog ce na /
translated: If you say that a thing that arises stops a non-thing,

original: smras pa / ji srid dngos po ma skyes pa de srid du dngos min mi ldog pas dngos po ma skyes par sngar gyi dngos min 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / ji srid dngos po ma skyes pa de srid du dngos min mi ldog pas dngos po ma skyes par sngar gyi dngos min 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then I say: For as long as a thing does not arise, for that long a non-thing is not stopped. Therefore, a non-thing that has not arisen does not cease.

original: gal te dngos min ma log par dngos @280b po skye /
analyzed: gal te dngos min ma log par dngos @280b po skye /
translated: If a thing arises without stopping a non-thing,

original: skyes nas 'gal bas dngos min bzlog ce na /
analyzed: skyes nas 'gal bas dngos min bzlog ce na /
translated: then after arising, a thing stops a non-thing through contradiction.

original: smras pa / dngos med la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos med la sogs pa'o //
translated: I say: A non-thing and so on.

original: dngos min ma log par dngos po la skabs med de /
analyzed: dngos min ma log par dngos po la skabs med de /
translated: A thing has no opportunity to arise without stopping a non-thing.

original: 'gal ba dngos min yod las so //
analyzed: 'gal ba dngos min yod las so //
translated: A contradiction exists due to a non-thing.

original: don dam par dngos po'i skye ba 'gag nas skyes pa bzlog pa med par bshad de /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i skye ba 'gag nas skyes pa bzlog pa med par bshad de /
translated: Ultimately, the arising of a thing is stopped. It is explained that after arising, a thing is not stopped.

original: dngos po'ang med bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'ang med bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: A thing does not become a non-thing.

original: ji ltar dngos min dngos por mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos min dngos por mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as something that is not a thing cannot become a thing,

original: de cis she na /
analyzed: de cis she na /
translated: why is that?

original: rang bzhin gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it would follow that it would have two natures.

original: gcig pu kho na la dngos po dang dngos min tshul gnyis mi srid pas so //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na la dngos po dang dngos min tshul gnyis mi srid pas so //
translated: It is not possible for a single thing to have both the character of being a thing and the character of not being a thing.

original: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus shing bshad de /
translated: This is the summary and explanation.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas /
translated: In this way, because there is neither arising nor cessation,

original: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med la dngos po'ang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med la dngos po'ang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: there is no cessation and no thing exists.

original: rtag tu ma skyas pa ma 'gags pa de bas /
analyzed: rtag tu ma skyas pa ma 'gags pa de bas /
translated: Because it is always unborn and unceasing,

original: 'gro ba 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: this entire world is essenceless.

original: 'o na kun rdzob kyi bden pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na kun rdzob kyi bden pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, what about conventional truth?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ris kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs nam skyes pa nyid mthong ba ltar /
analyzed: smras pa / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ris kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs nam skyes pa nyid mthong ba ltar /
translated: The conventional truth of the realms of hell and so on is like seeing what arises in the state of sleep.

original: kun rdzob rmongs pa la'ang de ltar ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob rmongs pa la'ang de ltar ro //
translated: So too is the conventional for the confused.

original: de bas kun rdzob ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas kun rdzob ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore the conventional is like a dream.

original: don dam pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is nonarising.

original: rnam par dpyad na chu shing dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na chu shing dang 'dra'o //
translated: When analyzed, it is like a plantain tree.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pas chu shing ltar snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pas chu shing ltar snying po med pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are essenceless, they are like a plantain tree, without a core.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med la 'gag pa med /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med la 'gag pa med /
translated: Since ultimately all phenomena are non-arisen and unceasing,

original: de bas mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / ma 'das pa ni sems 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur ba rnams te /
analyzed: de bas mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / ma 'das pa ni sems 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur ba rnams te /
translated: nirvana is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and non-nirvana is the mind that has come under the power of the afflictions such as desire and so forth.

original: de dag gnyi ga la don dam par dbye ba med la kun rdzob tu nyon mongs pa skye ba la sogs pa brtags pas so //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga la don dam par dbye ba med la kun rdzob tu nyon mongs pa skye ba la sogs pa brtags pas so //
translated: Since ultimately both of them are undifferentiated and conventionally the arising of the afflictions and so forth are imputed,

original: bshad pa'i rigs pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rigs pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skye ba la sogs pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since the reasonings that have been explained show that there is no difference between nirvana and non-nirvana because the arising of the afflictions and so forth do not exist.

original: 'di ltar de kho na nyid mi shes pas brdzun pa la mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de kho na nyid mi shes pas brdzun pa la mngon par zhe na /
translated: Thus, due to not knowing suchness, one is attached to falsity,

original: rang nyid kyis rang sdug bar byed ces bshad de /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rang sdug bar byed ces bshad de /
translated: and one makes oneself suffer.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i lam gyis thams cad rang bzhin med pa la gang rung las ci thob /üîΩgang rung gi su zhig la shor /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i lam gyis thams cad rang bzhin med pa la gang rung las ci thob / gang rung gi su zhig la shor /
translated: What is obtained from any of them?üîΩWhat is lost to any of them?üîΩWho is honored by whom?

original: rim gro byas pa'am yongs su brnyas pa sus su la slar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gro byas pa'am yongs su brnyas pa sus su la slar byed par 'gyur /
translated: Who is despised by whom?

original: dngos po la rang bzhin med pas gang las bde ba /
analyzed: dngos po la rang bzhin med pas gang las bde ba /
translated: Since things are essenceless, from what is there pleasure?

original: gang las sdug ste bde sdug gi rgyu med pas so //
analyzed: gang las sdug ste bde sdug gi rgyu med pas so //
translated: From what is there pain? Since there is no cause of pleasure or pain,üîΩwhat is there to be happy about?

original: gang dga' ba gang mi dga' ba @281a * //
analyzed: gang dga' ba gang mi dga' ba @281a * //
translated: What is there to be unhappy about?

original: gang dang phrad pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang phrad pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
translated: What is there to strive for in order to meet with or be separated from?üîΩWhat is craving?

original: sred pa gang yin pa'i ci la sred /
analyzed: sred pa gang yin pa'i ci la sred /
translated: What is craved?

original: gang gis 'khor ba de btsal bas gti mug tsam ste rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: gang gis 'khor ba de btsal bas gti mug tsam ste rang bzhin med do //
translated: Since samsara is sought, it is mere delusion; it is essenceless.

original: dpyad na gson pa'i 'jig rten gang yin te med pas so //
analyzed: dpyad na gson pa'i 'jig rten gang yin te med pas so //
translated: When analyzed, what is this living world? It does not exist.

original: gang zhig 'dir 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Who will die here?

original: gang zhig byung bar gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig byung bar gyur /
translated: Who has come into existence?

original: gang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Who will come into existence?

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ltos pa can yin pas so /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ltos pa can yin pas so /
translated: Since the past and so on are dependent,

original: gnyen dang bshes gang zhig gang gi yin /
analyzed: gnyen dang bshes gang zhig gang gi yin /
translated: what is a friend? What is a foe?

original: gang las mi dge ba dang srid par 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: gang las mi dge ba dang srid par 'chi ba'o //
translated: from which there is no good, and death in existence.

original: thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra ba bden pa'i don goms pa'i khyad par gyi mthar thug las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes la snang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra ba bden pa'i don goms pa'i khyad par gyi mthar thug las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes la snang ngo //
translated: All of this appears to the intuition of the yogi, which arises from the culmination of the special practice of the meaning of reality, which is like space.

original: de bas de bzhin du bdag 'dra ba gzhan gyis kyang de kho na nyid the tshom med par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas de bzhin du bdag 'dra ba gzhan gyis kyang de kho na nyid the tshom med par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, others like me should also apprehend reality without doubt in the same way.

original: gang mi shes pas byis pa rnams 'thab pa'i rgyus rab tu 'khrug spro ba'i rgyus dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gang mi shes pas byis pa rnams 'thab pa'i rgyus rab tu 'khrug spro ba'i rgyus dga' bar byed do //
translated: Because of ignorance, childish people are agitated by the cause of strife and delighted by the cause of enjoyment.

original: mya ngan dang / ngal ba dang / sgyid lug dang ; phan tshun du gcod pa dang 'bigs pa la sogs pa'i sdig pas bdag bde bar 'dod pa rnams tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang / ngal ba dang / sgyid lug dang ; phan tshun du gcod pa dang 'bigs pa la sogs pa'i sdig pas bdag bde bar 'dod pa rnams tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba'o //
translated: With the evil of grief, fatigue, and discouragement, and with the evil of mutual cutting, stabbing, and so on, those who desire happiness live with great difficulty.

original: de ltar zhe sdang dang 'dod pa la sogs pas ngan spyod byas te shi nas mi bzang sdug bsngal ngan song du yun rings ltung ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang dang 'dod pa la sogs pas ngan spyod byas te shi nas mi bzang sdug bsngal ngan song du yun rings ltung ste /
translated: Thus, having died after bad conduct with hatred, desire, and so on, they fall for a long time into bad rebirths with suffering and evil.

original: las zad na yang dang yang du bde 'gror 'ongs shing bde ba mang po spyad nas so //
analyzed: las zad na yang dang yang du bde 'gror 'ongs shing bde ba mang po spyad nas so //
translated: When the karma is exhausted, one returns again and again to the happy realms, and after experiencing much happiness,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med kyi srid pa la nye bar 'tshe ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med kyi srid pa la nye bar 'tshe ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: one is tormented by the various sufferings of existence in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: mi shes pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: This is due to the power of ignorance.

original: srid pa der ni de nyid ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa 'di 'dra rmongs par byed pa dang / de'i don du phan tshun du 'gal ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa der ni de nyid ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa 'di 'dra rmongs par byed pa dang / de'i don du phan tshun du 'gal ba 'byung ste /
translated: In that existence, one is confused about these things, such as form, which are not reality, and for their sake, one experiences mutual conflict.

original: mu bzhi dang bral ba'i de nyid mi rtogs pas so //
analyzed: mu bzhi dang bral ba'i de nyid mi rtogs pas so //
translated: This is because one does not understand reality, which is free from the four alternatives.

original: der yang dpe med cing mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal rgya mtsho mtha' las 'das pa dang / der ni de ltar brtson 'grus chung zhing der ni tshe yang thung ba nyid do //
analyzed: der yang dpe med cing mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal rgya mtsho mtha' las 'das pa dang / der ni de ltar brtson 'grus chung zhing der ni tshe yang thung ba nyid do //
translated: There, in that existence, one experiences an ocean of suffering, which is beyond the pale, and which is without parallel and unbearable. There, one‚Äôs effort is weak, and there, one‚Äôs life is short.

original: gson pa dang nad med pa la phan pa'i bya ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pas ngal pa dang ; gnyid dang / phyi nang gi 'tshe ba dang / byis pa dang 'grogs pas dgos pa med par dus 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gson pa dang nad med pa la phan pa'i bya ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pas ngal pa dang ; gnyid dang / phyi nang gi 'tshe ba dang / byis pa dang 'grogs pas dgos pa med par dus 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not waste time in activities that are harmful to life and health, or in the fatigue of hunger and thirst, or in sleep, or in the harm that comes from within and without, or in the company of fools.

original: de bas tshe ni don med par myur du 'da' la chags pa dang bral ba'i rnam dpyod shin tu rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: de bas tshe ni don med par myur du 'da' la chags pa dang bral ba'i rnam dpyod shin tu rnyed par dka'/
translated: Life passes quickly and without purpose. It is very difficult to find the freedom of discernment that is free from attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi dgra g-yeng ba dgag pa dka'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi dgra g-yeng ba dgag pa dka'o //
translated: Even if you are free from attachment, it is difficult to stop the enemy of distraction that is the foe of meditative concentration.

original: de'i @281b steng du ngan song chen por ltung bar byed pa'i ched du bdud brtson par byed /
analyzed: de'i @281b steng du ngan song chen por ltung bar byed pa'i ched du bdud brtson par byed /
translated: On top of that, Mara works hard to make you fall into the great lower realms.

original: der yang rgyang pan pa dang dpyod pa pa la sogs pa lam log pa mang bas the tshom spong ba dka'o //
analyzed: der yang rgyang pan pa dang dpyod pa pa la sogs pa lam log pa mang bas the tshom spong ba dka'o //
translated: There, too, it is difficult to overcome doubt, because there are many wrong paths, such as those of the LokƒÅyatas and the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas.

original: de ltar shi nas slar dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnyed pa de bas kyang dka' la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi chu bo bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de ltar shi nas slar dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnyed pa de bas kyang dka' la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi chu bo bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Having died in this way, it is difficult to find the freedoms and endowments again, and it is even more difficult to find the appearance of a Buddha. It is difficult to reverse the river of the mass of afflictions such as attachment and so forth.

original: de bas kye ma sdug bsngal brgyud par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas kye ma sdug bsngal brgyud par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, alas! There will be a succession of suffering.

original: gcig las thar kyang gzhan du ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig las thar kyang gzhan du ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is liberated from one thing but falls into another.

original: slar gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bas bshad de /
analyzed: slar gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bas bshad de /
translated: It is explained that one suffers again due to the suffering of others.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas phan pa dang gnod pa mi shes pas gong nas gong du yongs su gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chu bo la gnas pa /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas phan pa dang gnod pa mi shes pas gong nas gong du yongs su gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chu bo la gnas pa /
translated: In this way, through the stages of explanation, one does not know what is beneficial and what is harmful. Therefore, one abides in the river of suffering that is tormented more and more.

original: ma rig pas long bas rang gi sdug bsngal mi mthong ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pas long bas rang gi sdug bsngal mi mthong ba la /
translated: Since one is blinded by ignorance, one does not see one‚Äôs own suffering.

original: kyi hud mya ngan bya bar 'os /
analyzed: kyi hud mya ngan bya bar 'os /
translated: Alas! It is suitable to lament.

original: dpe bshad de /
analyzed: dpe bshad de /
translated: The example is explained.

original: ji ltar blo rgod pa 'ga' zhig yang yang khrus byas nas grang ba'i gdung bas /
analyzed: ji ltar blo rgod pa 'ga' zhig yang yang khrus byas nas grang ba'i gdung bas /
translated: For example, some crazy person, having bathed again and again, is tormented by the cold.

original: yang dang yang du me la 'jug pa ltar sems can 'di dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar bas bzung yang bdag nyid bde bar rlom pa bzhin gnas so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du me la 'jug pa ltar sems can 'di dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar bas bzung yang bdag nyid bde bar rlom pa bzhin gnas so //
translated: And just as the moths repeatedly fly into the fire, so these beings, though seized by the blazing fire of suffering, still imagine that they are happy.

original: rang nyid bag med pa mi mthong bar bshad de /
analyzed: rang nyid bag med pa mi mthong bar bshad de /
translated: It is explained that they do not see their own carelessness.

original: de ltar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: 'chi ba dang rgas pa med pa'i rol pa bzhin du spyod pa ci dgar gnas pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang rgas pa med pa'i rol pa bzhin du spyod pa ci dgar gnas pa rnams la /
translated: They live as they please, as if they were engaged in play without death or old age.

original: rgas pa dang na pa la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba bcos su med pa'i 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba mi bzad pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgas pa dang na pa la sogs pa 'jigs su rung ba bcos su med pa'i 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba mi bzad pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then, as if preceded by an unbearable, unconquerable death, there comes the terrible old age and sickness.

original: ji ltar rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in the RƒÅstrapƒÅla-parip·πõcchƒÅ:

original: phyogs bzhi nas ri bzhi bu ga med pa /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi nas ri bzhi bu ga med pa /
translated: ‚ÄúFour mountains come from the four directions,

original: sra ba nam mkha' reg cing /
analyzed: sra ba nam mkha' reg cing /
translated: solid, without gaps, touching the sky,

original: sa gzhi rmo zhing 'ong ba gang la brgyugs te 'bros pa sla ba ba ma yin /
analyzed: sa gzhi rmo zhing 'ong ba gang la brgyugs te 'bros pa sla ba ba ma yin /
translated: crushing the earth as they come. It is not easy to run away and escape.

original: de ltar rgas pa dang / na ba dang / gdung ba dang / 'chi ba bzhi /
analyzed: de ltar rgas pa dang / na ba dang / gdung ba dang / 'chi ba bzhi /
translated: In the same way, old age, sickness, and deathüîΩcome to destroy living beings.

original: dar la bab pa dang / nad med pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / gson pa rnams 'joms shing 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dar la bab pa dang / nad med pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / gson pa rnams 'joms shing 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the coming of old age, disease, and death, which destroy youth, health, prosperity, and life.

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir smon lam byed de /üîΩde ltar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir smon lam byed de / de ltar la sogs pa'o //
translated: He makes a prayer for the pacification of their suffering:üîΩWhen will I be able to pacify the suffering of beings?

original: sdug bsngal kho na med de /üîΩdpe gdungs ba rnams la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na med de / dpe gdungs ba rnams la /
translated: There is no suffering at all.

original: bsod nams kho na sprin te /
analyzed: bsod nams kho na sprin te /
translated: The clouds are only merit.

original: gdung ba sel bas so //
analyzed: gdung ba sel bas so //
translated: They dispel the heat.

original: de las byung ba bdag gi ba de ba'i yo byad gos dang zas la sogs pas bdag nam zhi bar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de las byung ba bdag gi ba de ba'i yo byad gos dang zas la sogs pas bdag nam zhi bar byed par 'gyur /
translated: From them, may there come forth for me the things that alleviate suffering, such as clothing and food.

original: mngon par mtho ba bshad nas /üîΩnges par legs pa @282a * //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba bshad nas / nges par legs pa @282a * //
translated: Having explained the high status of gods and humans,

original: bshad de / nam zhig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad de / nam zhig la sogs pa'o //
translated: he explains the definite goodness of liberation:

original: dngos por dmigs pa'i lta ba rnams la tshig dang rtog pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kun rdzob kyis nam ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa'i lta ba rnams la tshig dang rtog pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kun rdzob kyis nam ston par 'gyur /
translated: When will I be able to teach emptiness to those who are attached to things, emptiness which is not an object of words or thoughts?

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bshad nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the accumulation of wisdom,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bshad de /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bshad de /
translated: he explains the accumulation of merit:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs gus pas 'khor gsum du rang bzhin med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs gus pas 'khor gsum du rang bzhin med pa yang ngo //
translated: The chapter on generosity and so forth is the accumulation of merit, which is respectfully performed without the three spheres.

original: shes rab bstan pa'i le'u ni phung po ste /
analyzed: shes rab bstan pa'i le'u ni phung po ste /
translated: The chapter on wisdom is the aggregate.

original: de'i dgongs pa'i 'grel pa khyad par gsal byed ces bya ba dgu pa'o /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa'i 'grel pa khyad par gsal byed ces bya ba dgu pa'o /
translated: The commentary on its intention is called the Illuminator of Distinctions, the ninth.

original: // / yongs su bsngo ba bshad de /
analyzed: // / yongs su bsngo ba bshad de /
translated: The dedication is explained.

original: bdag gi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, mine and so forth.

original: byang chub ni yon tan dang skyon ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i mthar thug la gnas pa /
analyzed: byang chub ni yon tan dang skyon ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i mthar thug la gnas pa /
translated: Enlightenment is the ultimate abode of the increase of qualities and the decrease of faults.

original: de kho na nyid kyi shes rab dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi shes rab dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: It is the wisdom of reality and omniscience.

original: de'i slad du spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa goms pa ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du spyod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa goms pa ste /
translated: For that reason, practice is the cultivation of generosity and so forth.

original: de la 'jug pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnams dgu gang gis de ni de bzhin no //
